explanation: Funds are available due to lagging execution of other section 1202 of the NDAA for FY 2018, as amended, CONOPS as a result of re-scoped operational requirements and delayed access to in-country teams due to continued foreign country COVID-19 restrictions. This is base budget funding.

Funds are required to procure long lead materials and equipment and to stand up Partner Network 1, a bilateral communications network established to facilitate command and control between Israel and U.S. Central Command (USCENTCOM). This is required for the USCENTCOM Unified Command Plan because Israel is transitioning to the USCENTCOM area of responsibility from U.S. European Command. USCENTCOM must build the bilateral network point of presence at USCENTCOM and transition control of the instantiation of the bilateral network from USEUCOM. Failure to procure the components of the bilateral network for which the times to design and fabricate are extremely long creates unacceptable risk in USCENTCOMâ€™s ability to command and control to implement Operation Plans, Concept of Operations Plans, and exercises. This is a base budget requirement.
Funds are available because of a delay in a Final Lifetime Extension Program (FLEP) within ATO. There are no major impacts to the program. This is base budget funding.
Funds are required to procure communication security (COMSEC) equipment to maintain COMSEC inventory in accordance with Committee on National Security Systems (CNNS) Instruction No. 4007.

Funds are available from the sale to foreign partners of 81 Simple Key Loaders (SKL), 10 fill cables, and 2 KY-100 Airborne Terminals with transactions occurring between October 2019 and September 2020.
